result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Tesar Sr.

defendant.name: Tesar, Patrick M, Sr.
defendant.address: 1515 S Beaumont Road, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

2021CF000091, 2022CF000007, 2022CF000064, 2022CF000065, 2022CF000119
Attorney Burdick is heard on the status of the cases. Requests another status.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:33 AM Cases called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF91, 22CF07, 22CF64, 22CF65 & 22CF119 called together
Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by phone. 

22CF119 - Preliminary Hearing
Atty Burdick states def. is waiving preliminary - has reviewed plea questionnaire with defendant

Court questions def. re: waiver of preliminary hearing
Court finds waiver is freely knowingly and voluntarily made, accepts defendants waiver of preliminary hearing and finds probable cause

Defendant waives formal reading, stands mute
Clerk directed to enter NOT GUILTY pleas into the record for all counts

Atty Burdick states first four cases are resolved - would be ideal to keep all cases together. Do have an offer on newest case that he will discuss with def. 
Court will schedule all cases for status, if newest case is resolved can get a plea and sentencing date for all
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Andrew Burdick

1:38 PM Case called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF91, 22CF07, 22CF64, 22CF65, 22CF119 called together
Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Patrick M Tesar Sr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court - 22CF119 needs Preliminary hearing
Atty. Burdick is heard on status - has received offer on newest case, requests preliminary hearing on most recent case- then all cases can ride together

 Court advises def. that she has signed the conditional release for his forfeiture matters

Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am. (for case 22CF119 only - Status hrg on remaining cases)
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:08 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr. in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:47 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Tesar Sr appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County Jail. Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  No contact with R.B.

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No abusive or violent contact with R.B. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No abusive or violent contact with R.B.
